message.content:
cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with a game-theoretic problem of network interdiction, which involves the removal of arcs or paths from a network to minimize the flow of material through it. This problem has applications in various fields, including computer science, operations research, and national security. The paper presents a randomized version of the problem and analyzes its modeling power, complexity, and approximability. The paper uses techniques from combinatorial optimization, graph theory, and probability theory. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics), cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory), cs.NE (Computational Neuroscience), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.LG (Machine Learning).
